The Subconscious of the artist is communicating if not communing with both the sub- & -consciousness of the person experiencing the visual art.David Bennett Cohen Bio:DBC - current uTube performance - Cookin With Cohen: https://youtu.be/EoWMpPh0WJw?list=PLr8ZEsFDiy-6...Over the years, he has played and/or recorded with: Original keyboard player with Country Joe and the Fish,  The Blues Project, Mick Taylor, The Luther Tucker Blues Band, Elvin Bishop, Hubert Sumlin, Melvin Van Peebles, Happy and Artie Traum, Arlen Roth, Eric Anderson, David Blue, Tim Hardin, Norton Buffalo, Jerry Miller, Jimi Hendrix, Johnny Winter, Buddy Miles, John Cippolina, Huey Lewis, Michael Bloomfield, Bob Weir, John Kahn, Johnnie Johnson, Jimmy Vivino, Jay Owens, Debbie Davies, Byther Smith, Bobby Kyle, Rocky Lawrence, Johnny B. Gayden, Sandra Feva and others.As a solo performer, he has shared the bill with Country Joe McDonald, Kenny Rankin, Bonnie Raitt, Richard Thompson, Jerry Garcia, Leo Kottke, Rufus Thomas, Meatloaf, Booker T., The Roches, Kingfish, J. Giles and Magic Dick and many others.

story:
One Fantastic Lady...

My grandmother, Virginia Henetz, was a spicy full-blooded Italian with a fierce love for friends and family.  She was a fantastic cook as well, bringing people together with a warm heart and wonderful meals.


Let's invite her back for the holidays, again!

For the second year in a row, the Henetz family and friends will honor Virginia's tradition of creating community through cooking by:

  • Raising funds for a full week of meals for the clients of OPCC, a community organization serving our neighbors most in need in West Los Angeles.
  • Serving a meal of Grandma's famous cacciatore and antipasto for the 35 residents of OPCC's Daybreak Shelter on Monday, December 8th.  (Let us know if you'd like to join us!)


Why we want YOU to get cooking with us.

On any given day, 170 homeless people are depending on OPCC for temporary shelter, case management and 3 hot meals.  OPCC really makes a dollar stretch: $2,329 will provide 3,570 meals, a whole week of full plates for every resident.

By providing a basic need, like hot meals, we are helping OPCC's clients to focus on their many other challenges, like physical ailments, substance addiction, and mental illness.  Therefore, the larger benefit of these full plates isn't just satisfied tummies, it is the freedom you provide to a small group of people to transform their lives.


Please help; provide a few meals now :)

Please join my family and I by sponsoring how many ever meals you can, from one person's meals for the week ($13) to every resident's meals for on full day ($332).  Your donation will make a difference, please join in now, with our thanks!

story:
Our Story

Having developed home product lines for companies including Martha Stewart Living, Jamie is now looking to realize his dream of creating and selling high-quality, handmade, sustainably produced home goods.  

Jamie believes there is no more important place in the world than home.  And that neither style nor our resources should be sacrificed.

All items are one-of-a-kind and hand-crafted in his own home studio.  Jamie Godfrey Home Collection products include:


  • Embroidered/Printed Duvets & Pillowcases
  • Embroidered/Printed Table Linens & Guest Towels
  • Quilts & Quilted Shams
  • Decorative Pillows
  • Soy Candles, Room Sprays & Sachets
  • Soaps & Bath Salts
  • Original Works of Art


And this is just the beginning...organic pantry items, printed/embroidered sheet sets and gift items could be easily added to the mix. 


Please help Jamie realize his dream today!!!




The Impact

In our mass-produced, throw-away marketplace, there is something truly wonderful about a product that has been made individually, touched by human hands.  

Domestically produced textiles that are made with passion and care, to extend from one generation to the next.  Consumables that use organic and sustainable, local resources so you are confident they are great for you, your home and the planet.  




What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will fund the following:


  • Product materials: fabric, notions, wax & bases, essential oils, containers, packaging, etc.
  • Production costs: hiring of local artisans to help with production demands.
  • E-commerce website: creation and deployment, including professional photography.

What you will receive:

In addition to the satisfaction of helping someone fulfill their dream, you will also receive wonderful handmade items for you and your home!!  The selection is at the right...take a look!




Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word by sharing this campaign with your friends and family via Facebook, Twitter, and e-mail!  Even if you cannot make a financial donation today, help spread the word to those who can!

story:
See Rewards =======>>>


The proceeds from this shirt campaign go to fund "Free Energy" research and Development.


The Vision

 My name is Bryan VanWagner (Brayn), and for most of my life I have worked in the Aviation field. For years, I have had this concept for a "Free Energy" machine, but I never had the time to build it. Now that I am semi-retired, I have more time, but I have less money... so I've created a t-shirt design that I am offering as a reward for those that contribute to my research and development of this machine. 


The Reason

 We are all looking to a better and cleaner future. Many people complain about the way things are, but do nothing to make a change. Here is your chance to help make a difference in the future and receive a cool shirt in return. 


The Rewards

For your generous contribution, you can receive one of the rewards listed on the right. 

This awesome shirt design can be seen in the light AND in the dark and is printed on quality apparel.

We will start sending shirts out as soon as we hit 20 shirt rewards.







What We Need 

Ongoing research requires money for purchasing parts and materials. I hope to soon build a test model which will allow me to test some theories, and hopefully lead to a working prototype. Watch the updates for... um... updates.



    If you can't contribute, you have to share it!

    (Sorry, that's just the rules (according to me))
    • Share this campaign on your social sites. 
    • Email the link to all your geek friends. 
    • Tell your friends about this.
    • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
My name is Chloe Lynch, I am now 3 months pregnant! I go to school and work a night time job as a bartender. I am so excited about this baby and other expecting mama's, I was diagnosed with cervical cancer and was told I was not able to have children and I was crushed, so truly this is a dream come true!

This is my very first campaign, basically I am trying to raise money to purchase many tools such as a sewing machine, a large desk and crocheting needles and much yarn to produce baby clothes and toys!! Some funds would also be going towards a website that I will have built, I have so many cute designs and ideas to easily start a business to start donations to babies in need right from home!

If you guys can help me reach my goal, I will be happy to make outfits and toys for your baby too!

It would mean the world if you were the person who changed my life for helping me achieve what it is I have so much passion for,  I want to quit being a bartender cause it can be overwhelming and stressful and soon Ill only be able to waddle so fast! :D

story:
Congratulations to Cyrus, Karen and Sydney!!! Your brand new Fujifilm Camera will be delivered to you by Elijah when he returns from Spain!

JOIN ME IN MY JOURNEY.

You're never too young to travel. Especially where the big players train. My name is Elijah Sandiford and I want to play soccer for the rest of my life.

I started playing at age 8 because up until I was 7 years old, I did everything from hip hop dance to acting, and basketball, but was never truly satisfied until I landed a part as a soccer kid in the 2013 BMO Soccer commercial. I'm currently 9 years old and I finally found my passion next to acting. 

Now I live, breath and dream about soccer.

I have been blessed with the opportunity to train at the Real Madrid Training Complex in Madrid, Spain. To be able to train where some of the world's best players trained, will help me to get to the next level. I know I have a long way to go but the ride has been awesome so far because I love playing soccer so much and I have many more goals to score!

I want to be the best soccer player I can be and make it to the professional league and play with the world's best players. I train almost everyday and every chance I get. I sometimes bring my friends to my practices to watch just so I can still spend time with them considering my busy schedule.
________________________________________________________________

The best reward for me other than winning championships, and scoring goals, would be to give back to everyone that has helped me along the way.  Thank you to all my incredible coaches in Pickering and Toronto, my family, my friends and my supporters! I will be grateful for any wise words of encouragement or helpful advice as I take another leap on this stepping stone towards my future success.

A special thank you to those that have helped my mom and I to overcome life's unexpected tragedies with their love and support.

This trip means the world to me and I promise to make you proud!

Thank you from the bottom of my heart!

Elijah

story:
Amanda & Dana's Extravaganza, Class of 2013 Fashion Show

Last year, Amanda DaCosta and Dana Folkes launched a Future Project that brought their entire school together to celebrate fashion and talent and the beauty of young people at Richard R Green High School. They brought hundreds together to watch scenes designed by students.

See the footage here: http://vimeo.com/42106408#at=0

They're back again this year, bigger and better.

Due to some new fundraising regulations at the school, they need your help to get the money it takes to put on such a show.

Costs include:

-stage / carpet

-chairs

-DJ

-decoration

-lights

 

The show is on Thursday, May 23rd. Tickets will be available ahead of time, but get 'em soon, because they sold out last year! Contact dacosta.amanda94@gmail.com to purchase one.

 

Check out www.thefutureproject.org to learn more about The Future Project and Richard R Green.

story:
Invisible Criminals is a non-profit initiative aimed at ending the conflict that has claimed more lives in the Congo than the Holocaust over minerals that are used in everyday technology. (more info: conflictminerals.org)

The project is to make our logo on fair trade organic t-shirts (through American Apparel) and send $10 from every shirt sold to panzihospital.org in the Congo to help treat raped women who are prone to being shunned by their spouses and families due to the heightened AIDS risk. The situation in the Congo has been rated by the UN as the WORST human rights case out of ALL of the world's countries.
 With these shirts, we can help the Congo directly, as well as raise much-needed attention to this issue.

What We Need & What You Get

We need a minimum of $2000 to make our first order of t-shirts which will then be available in Toronto stores as well as online at invisiblecriminals.org (currently under construction) As the project grows, the shirts will be available in more and more cities in Canada and the U.S.
If we don't reach our goal, the money that has been raised will be given directly to Panzi Hospital.

Invisible Criminals' art has already been in NOW magazine and given interviews to OMNI television and independant media. All work done by I.C. is volunteer, as no one wants to profit from other people's suffering.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can't donate money, you can still help out by getting properly informed on the subject of Coltan/Tantalum mining in the Congo: watch "Blood in the Mobile", or the "VICE travel guide to Congo", and please tell others, and try not to suppourt the blood mineral industry by only buying used phones and computers. Stay posted on Fairphone.com for a fully Fair Trade smartphone currently available in Europe!

story:
Atheer AiR™ - The World’s Most Interactive Smart Glasses Platform for Deskless Professionals


Our Indiegogo campaign has ended, but you can find out more about Atheer at http://atheerair.com/.

Read what the press has been saying about us:

"Why can't Google Glass do THIS?" - Robert Scoble
"Hailed as Google Glass meets 3-D" - Fast Company
"Watch their vision; we dare you not to get excited" - Mashable
"Reaching Beyond Google Glass" - VentureBeat


A Rich and Interactive Experience with AiR Glasses

Atheer’s smart glasses empower users to view critical work information right in the field-of-view. Natural gestures, voice commands and motion tracking make the glasses intuitive and easy to use for hands-on tasks.  

Real-Time Collaboration with AiR Enterprise Suite

Increase efficiency and reduce downtime by teaming up with remote experts via video calls. Receive guidance in real-time through image annotations, new workflows and resolve problems quickly.

Breakthrough Solutions for Fortune 1000 companies

“Our growing pilot engagements with Fortune 1000 companies in industrial, energy, insurance, construction, healthcare and logistics sectors are a testament to the accelerating needs of deskless professionals and the fitting solution of our AiR platform,“ - Alberto Torres.

story:
20 Phazed Fashion is an up and coming full service fashion company. We wanted to do something that was different, unique, and a little mysterious as well. We also didn’t want to limit the growth of our company by choosing a defined path.

It has been a challenge getting our company started. We have had setbacks, let downs, and disappointments. However, we have tried to stay positive through out our journey. We will continue to do so and encourage others to do the same.

We have a lot of wonderful things that we hope to do in the future, such as a fashion magazine, clothing line, and even a fashion consulting service. However, we must take our fashion story one chapter at a time and begin with the basics. Our first chapter is simply our boutique.

What we want for our boutique is to offer an experience instead of just a purchase. #ThePhazedLife is a lifestyle not just a hashtag. Our slogan is “Fashion, Food, and Life … The Phazed Life”. Our mission is to provide a fashion experience that is unique and empowering.

We value positivity and forward thinking. We refrain from the use of obsessive profanity, negative comments, and bullying. We encourage women, girls, and people in general to pursue their goals and to avoid limiting themselves. 

Our boutique will be opening (online) on 08-01-2014 and is going to sell women’s and juniors’ clothing. The items that are going to be sold initially are going to be shirts, pants, shoes, accessories, and jewelry. In the future, we hope to add make up and nail care items to our inventory.

We have suppliers lined up that we are hoping to work with. In the future, we hope to add our own brand of clothing to our inventory as well. 

Below is a screen shot of our boutique which is in pre-order status until August! You can still make purchases, they just take longer than normal. We offer International Shipping. Visit our Boutique!


We are hoping that we will be able to bring more jobs to our community with the opening of a physical location. In addition to that, we plan to donate 1% of the sales proceeds from our boutique, and 1% of all donations received during this campaign to Women for Women International. 

Women for Women International envisions a world where no one is abused, poor, illiterate or marginalized; where members of communities have full and equal participation in the processes that ensure their health, well-being and economic independence; and where everyone has the freedom to define the scope of their life, their future and strive to achieve their full potential.

Women are enrolled in an one year program that helps them to rebuild their lives and even helps some of them become business owners. This organization has truly touched us and we would love to help. We are all about empowering women, and people in general. You can view this short video to learn more about their charity. 


The donations that we receive will be used to help open our boutique. Currently, our boutique is only going to be online. We love the online platform, but we are hoping to raise enough money to open a physical location too. We list a goal of $1,000, but in order to open a physical location we need to raise $25,000. So, please keep donating even if you see the goal is met. Some of the things we will be using the funds on are:

Goal #1: $1,000 would go towards inventory, shipping materials, and advertising.

Goal #2: $10,000 would go towards inventory, shipping materials, adveritising, fund raising efforts, and other overhead cost.

Goal #3: $25,000 would go towards all that is listed below:

We are very grateful and humbled by any donations that we receive. We appreciate you simply taking the time to read this and even considering donating. For your donations, we have the following perks!

* Fan shirts come in size S, M, L, XL, and XXL. The white and blue shirts are a tight fit, if you want them to fit relaxed, request 1 size larger than your normal size.*Shipping for the shirts is through USPS. If you live outside of the US, please add an additional $20 for shipping.

There are many ways to help! We completely understand that not everyone has the money to donate. We appreciate the fact that you simply took time out of your day to read this! If you want to help out in other ways, here are some things you can do

1)  You can share this! – Even though you may not be able to donate someone else may be able to. The more you share, the more people will see and hopefully donate.

2) Follow us! – Sometimes we just need to hear encouraging words, or just know someone cares! If you are a positive person, we would love to chat and stay connected with you. You can find us on!
Twitter  |  Facebook  |  Tumblr

1)  Favorite this page or Follow! – Even though you may not be able to donate now, who knows, you may be able to in the future.  You can come back later and donate or even just share the page via social media later. To follow this page, click follow located at the top of this page in the “Share this campaign” section.

2)  Advice – We would love to hear your ideas and input about how to do things. We would also love to hear about other ways we can raise funds for our business as well. 


Thank you for taking the time to view and read about our campaign. We truly appreciate it, and have a great day! - Cinna Henry

all donations received during this campaign to Women for Women International. Women for Women International envisions a world
where no one is abused, poor, illiterate or marginalized; where members of
communities have full and equal participation in the processes that ensure
their health, well-being and economic independence; and where everyone has the
freedom to define the scope of their life, their future and strive to achieve
their full potential.
Women are enrolled in an one year program that helps
them to rebuild their lives and even helps some of them become business owners.
This organization has truly touched us and we would love to help. We are all about
empowering women, and people in general. You can view this short video to learn
more about their charity. The donations that we receive will be used to help open
our boutique. Currently, our boutique is only going to be online. We love the
online platform, but we are hoping to raise enough money to open a physical
location too. We list a goal of $1,000, but in order to open a physical
location we need to raise $25,000.
So, please keep donating even if you see the goal is met. Some of the things we
will be using the funds on are:
Goal #1: $1,000 would go towards inventory, shipping
materials, and advertising.
Goal #2: $10,000 would go towards inventory,
shipping materials, adveritising, fund raising efforts, and other overhead
cost.
Goal #3: $25,000 would go towards all that is listed
below:We are very grateful and humbled by any donations
that we receive. We appreciate you simply taking the time to read this and even
considering donating. For your donations, we have the following perks!
* Fan shirts come in size S, M, L, XL, and XXL. The
white and blue shirts are a tight fit, if you want them to fit relaxed, request
1 size larger than your normal size.*Shipping for the shirts is through USPS. If you live outside of the US, please add an additional $20 for shipping.There are many ways to help! We completely
understand that not everyone has the money to donate. We appreciate the fact
that you simply took time out of your day to read this! If you want to help out
in other ways, here are some things you can do
1)  You can share this!
– Even though you may not be able to donate someone else may be able to. The
more you share, the more people will see and hopefully donate.

2) Follow us! – Sometimes we just need to hear encouraging
words, or just know someone cares! If you are a positive person, we would love
to chat and stay connected with you. You can find us on! Twitter  |  Facebook  |  Tumblr1)  Favorite this page or Follow!
– Even though you may not be able to donate now, who knows, you may be able to
in the future.  You can come back later
and donate or even just share the page via social media later. To follow this
page, click follow located at the top of this page in the “Share this campaign”
section. 
2)  Advice
– We would love to hear your ideas and input about how to do things. We would
also love to hear about other ways we can raise funds for our business as well. Thank you for taking the time to view and read about our campaign. We truly appreciate it, and have a great day! - Cinna Henry

story:
CIAO !!
VUOI LA NUOVA T-SHIRT O IL NUOVO CD DEGLI INBRED KNUCKLEHEAD ???
 
BASTA SEGUIRE LE ISTRUZIONI DI QUESTO LINK !!!
 
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/inbred-knucklehead-t-shirt/contributions/new
 
 
Il metodo è quello di contribuire e di aiutare gli IKH a stampare le loro nuove T-SHIRT ovviamente per farlo bisognera' produrle e questo costerà alla band circa 
700 euro !!
 
A questo punto se vuoi aiutarli puoi contribuire anche solo simbolicamente mettendo soltanto 1 EURO nel loro salvadanaio ;-)
 
OVVIAMENTE chi contribuirà con delle somme più alte 
di 1 EURO avrà un omaggio a seconda di quanto ha versato 
 
 
AD ESEMPIO :
 
con un minimo di 10 euro 
RICEVERAI la nuova t-shirt in omaggio una volta che sarà stampata
 
con un minimo di 20 euro 
RICEVERAI la nuova t-shirt + il loro nuovo cd "family Album"
 
con un minimo di 25 euro 
RICEVERAI il loro primo cd + il loro nuovo cd "family Album" + la nuova t-shirt
 
 
I CONTRIBUTI SI VERSANO TRAMITE 
PAYPAL
 
NON E' UNA FREGATURA PERCHE' VI MANDEREMO NOI STESSI DELLA BAND I REGALI SAPENDO ESATTAMENTE CHI E QUANTO HA VERSATO !!!!
 
se non potete spendere almeno 10 euro potete comunque spendere di meno 
 
BASTA ANCHE SOLTANTO 1 EURO
 
 
AIUTACI A RAGGIUNGERE IL NOSTRO GOAL !!!
CONTRIBUISCI A STAMPARE LE NOSTRE NUOVE T-SHIRT
 
GRAZIE  !!!!

story:
Bonjour,

Je suis Katy St-Laurent, présidente-designer de KSL et ex-cycliste professionnelle (championne canadienne en 2002). Je suis une femme passionnée qui croit en elle et en ses rêves. J’ai fondé KSL en 2007 en proposant aux femmes des vêtements cyclistes différents conçus pour elles. Aujourd’hui, nous proposons des vêtements pouvant s’adapter à plusieurs sports (souvent transformables) qui sont aussi très pratiques pour les voyages. Notre mission est de motiver les femmes à réaliser leurs rêves.

Nous croyons réellement qu'il est plus motivant de s'adonner à un sport ou d'être simplement plus actives lorsqu'on se sent à la fois belle et confortable. Nous apposons d'ailleurs, sur chacun des vêtements, un bijou qui symbolise l’importance de vos rêves de votre vie.

Nos vêtements sont fabriqués à 100% au Québec. Même les tissus sont le plus souvent de provenance locale. Nous croyons à l’industrie manufacturière d’ici.  Ainsi, nous misons sur un produit de qualité et différent pour nous démarquer. 

Depuis notre passage à l’émission Dans l’oeil du Dragon à Radio-Canada en 2012, notre compagnie ne cesse de croître, beaucoup de clientes nous ont alors découvert. Ainsi, nous avons déménagé notre boutique de la rue St-Denis dans un espace plus visible et avons formé une équipe hors pair, prête à relever de nouveaux défis. 

Prochain objectif: Ouvrir une boutique KSL à Québec.

Depuis les 6 dernières années, nous avons établi un plan de visibilité dans la Capitale Nationale. Nous avons participé activement aux événements sportifs (à titre d’exposants) : Vélirium du Mont-Ste-Anne, Marathon des Deux Rives, Transat Québec St-Malot, etc.  

Nous organisons aussi, plusieurs fois par années, des soirées privées à Rimouski, Chicoutimi et Québec, qui sont toujours un franc succès.

Pour ces raisons, nous sommes convaincus qu’une boutique KSL à Québec sera très bien accueillie par les femmes de l'Est de la province.

Notre budget: 40 000$.

Votre contribution nous permettra:

- d’acquérir le matériel divers pour les améliorations locatives de la boutique (présentoires, mannequins, enseignes, miroirs, luminaires, comptoir, etc);

- de se procurer les indispensables pour la facturation: ordinateur de caisse, serveur, scanneur, etc);

- de payer les différents permis, le dépôt de sécurité du loyer et le premier mois de roulement;

- de fabriquer l’inventaire nécessaire à l’ouverture.

Femmes, soyons solidaires

Je suis l’unique propriétaire de mon entreprise et j’en suis très heureuse puisque mes valeurs y sont alors privilégiées. En contribuant à l’ouverture de cette boutique, non seulement vous contribuez à l’essor de l’économie du Québec, mais en plus, vous encouragez des centaines de femmes québécoises à poursuivre leur travail dans un milieu qui les passionne.

Au-delà des contributions en argent qui peuvent nous aider, vous pouvez également participer à la réussite de notre projet en parlant de nous et en partageant notre vidéo à vos ami(e)s. N’oubliez pas de venir nous voir lorsque la boutique sera ouverte pour partager à votre tour votre rêve sur notre mur.

À bientôt,

Katy St-Laurent

Présidente-designer | KSL

story:
Short Summary

Need to impress your date? A few friends? Or even your future employer? First thing, you got to look good! How?Ask your mum or your trolling friends what to wear? Nope! You use OutFeed. A **FREE** fashion photo-feedback app which helps you to ask the world for feedback on your outfit instantly! 

Here's a 60% completed OutFeed:

OutFeed Canada

OutFeed USA

These features will be out in 1-2 weeks of time:

  1. Past Outfits in album style.
  2. More user friendly rating method.
  3. Top OutFeeders page.

OutFeed Facebook Page |OutFeed Twitter Page |OutFeed Website

Why do we need money?

We need the funding mainly because the workload is exceeding the working capacity of the founders, so we need some cash to:

  1. Expand Development Team.
  2. Create Impactful Marketing Campaigns.
  3. Apply Patent On An Algorithm For Providing Instantaneous Feedback On Outfits.
  4. Setting Up OutFeed Servers.


LET'S MAKE THIS IDEA HAPPEN!


Why did we make OutFeed?

To help people become more confident in what they're wearing by providing a second opinion.

Every morning, we dress up to go out. On the weekend, we go to malls to buy more clothing for our wardrobe. Why? To enjoy feeling fashionable and to (secretly) enjoy others glancing at us while we walk down the street. That glance is like a silent compliment, and it sure starts our day feeling great about ourselves! 

BUT what if we aren't sure about our fashion choices? That glance could make us feel a bit uncomfortable, and we might feel like all the money and effort we spent in dressing up ended up in vain.

That is why we made OutFeed, so that you can ask others how you look before leaving the house or before you buy that piece of clothing. Get a second opinion on your decision, so that you can feel even more confident! Try OutFeed today!


OutFeed in a Glance

Who made OutFeed?

Justin Chan is a finance major and math minor student (4th yr) attending the University of British Columbia, and he is responsible for the business admin and technical part of OutFeed. 

Justin was very shy in his appeal back in a couple years ago, until he was offered to meet with a stylist in his 2nd year. Afterward, Justin understands how to look good and feel good. 

Simon is a combined major of business and computer science student (2nd yr) in the University of British Columbia. Simon specializes in the marketing aspects of the company (app design and promotion).

Simon also had faced problems like Justin's. Simon usually consults his friends and relative on his appearance. However, Simon didn't think their opinion was useful enough. Thus, Simon suggested to Justin that they, together, should create an app that offers fashion feedback through peer evaluation.

Jolie is a fashion designer with an impressive background and work experience in the fashion world: 

  • 2006: Created Jolie Couture, which originally designed Haute Couture gowns worldwide, including in Canada, China and France
  • 2009: Expanded the Jolie Couture business into organizing Fashion Shows, Charity Galas, and Photo Shoots and into providing Wardrobe Styling Advice
  • 2010: Designed gowns for Canada's Medal Ceremony at the Vancouver 2010 Olympics
  • http://www.joliecouture.ca/

Who would use OutFeed?

Our main users are females aged 15-35. These users range from youths to fashionistas who wants to know what they’re wearing is considered “liked” by the general population. Also, this market segment also seems to be active in providing feedback towards other users:

  • Geographic: Users of iOS and Android Operating Systems
  • Psychographic: People who care how they look.
  • Occupation: Students and young professionals

Our secondary customers are males also in the same age range, who may use the app on occasions such as before dates and interviews.

To improve the quality of fashion feedback and also fashion inspiration, we are creating premium accounts for fashion boutiques, bloggers and fashionistas.

Here's a picture to describe the use of these accounts.


How to make OutFeed be known?

  • Fashion Bloggers: We are contacting fashion bloggers and introducing them to our app. If necessary, we will also pay them to promote our app through their blogging platforms.
  • Fashion Industry Contacts: We seek advisors who can guide us and connect us to multiple fashion designers, and small boutique owners, which we believe will be the early adopters, and then help us to spread the app through word of mouth.
  • Campus Event: As students we have the advantage of launching events in UBC / SFU or any other large educational institution. We can set up a booth with mirrors, so that people can try out the app at the spot during our promotion. So far, we have a list of fifteen volunteers to help organize these booths.
  • Social Media: Since application is closely tied with Internet, promoting our app on social media is just an essential component in marketing.
  • Sponsorship: As a fashion app, we hope to improve peoples' confidence in their appearance. To start, we are going to sponsor a couple types of events so that they allocate an area for our booths.

Perks:

Here are some cool perks for the users or fashion boutiques:

  1. $1 - Any bit of money helps. Thank you for being a friend.
  2. $5 - "Good job, guys!", said by you.
  3. $25 - "Good guy contributor". We will create a page on our website and app to recognize the contributors!

Use of Funding (Seed Round)

After getting all these "hugs" and "lunches", this is the ratio on how we are planning to distribute the funds.

  • 40% to app development for other mobile platforms.
  • 40% to marketing. 
  • 10% to legal / business admin.
  • 10% to patent pending registration.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give us anything, it's perfectly fine! We would like to thank you for reading this long post. Haha! If you want, you can still do the following things to help us:

  • Please tell us what  you want to see in this app's future versions.
  • Spread the word! let people know about this!

Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't give us anything, it's perfectly fine! We would like to thank you for reading this long post. Haha! If you want, you can still do the following things to help us:

story:
HAHN

I moved to Hahn Air Force Base as a third grader in 1976, eventually graduating from Hahn High School in 1986. After moving to "the States" I continually had to explain "where I went to high school." It can be difficult saying goodbye to your friends after a unique, and for many of us, intense experience growing up overseas. As a third culture Cold War kid I take pride in that experience and want to represent! So here we go.

HAHN HAWKS T-SHIRT

IF you still have a Hahn t-shirt, sweatshirt or letter jacket most likely it not longer fits. Let's make a new batch of Hahn Hawks t-shirts to wear proudly. Go HAWKS!

HOW THIS WORKS

Just order a shirt. Order two. Order some for your mom, sister and cat. The more we make the better quality shirt I can order. If we exceed $300 I should be able to make some cool circular stickers too. Specify your size in a message with your payment or in an email to me. Remember, we're putting in an order and this campaign doesn't end until mid-November.

WHAT YOU GET

A green cotton t-shirt (short or long-sleeve), or sweatshirt with the design shown. I'd get one of each!

(Please remember IndieGoGo takes a cut of your contribution, I have to pay the graphic designer (thanks Doug Kubert!), the shirts need to be purchased and screen printed, and I need to pay for shipping.)

*By the way, the $500 goal is nuts--that is the minimum indiegogo allowed me to set. 

NOW MAKE SOME NOISE

Please send a link to this IndieGoGO campaign to your Hahn Facebook friends and email anybody else that lived at Hahn. 

GO HAWKS!

story:
Hi I'm Tina, an emerging fashion/textile designer. My designs include a range of knits, beadwork, and vintage materials, all in favor to a more healthier planet and society at large. I have been asked to showcase a collection at this years LA Fashion Week Design Competition.

Your financial support to Tina Summers Designs will help to achieve our dreams as we reach back to help others achieve theirs. It is so much more than just a clothing line, it is a way to help build the confidence of women with quality, unique clothing.

Help us connect to our Los Angeles base fashionistas by getting us to LAFWDC. If you don’t have the means to make a financial contribution, please share our link with your social networks and help spread our campaign to the world!


The Funds raised will go towards:

 Purchasing vintage pieces, fabric, and yarn for print

Finalizing orders for embellishments and trimmings

Hiring a seamstress to help with production of garments 

Purchasing accessories and shoes for styling 

 

Our Need:

We need $3,000.00 to cover the supply fees to LA Fashion Week Design Competition


Other Ways You Can Help

Please forward this to a friend, share it on your social media sites, and encourage others to contribute - Every bit counts!

clothing line, it is a way to help build the confidence of women with quality, unique
clothing. 
Help
us connect to our Los Angeles base fashionistas by getting us to LAFWDC. If you
don’t have the means to make a financial contribution, please share our link
with your social networks and help spread our campaign to the world!
The Funds raised will go towards:
 Purchasing vintage pieces, fabric, and yarn for print
Finalizing
orders for embellishments and trimmings
Hiring a
seamstress to help with production of garments 
Purchasing
accessories and shoes for styling 
 Our Need:
We need $3,000.00
to cover the supply fees to LA Fashion Week Design Competition
Other Ways You Can Help
Please forward this to a friend, share it on your social
media sites, and encourage others to contribute - Every bit counts!

story:
FINAL UPDATE:

Korean Prototype Building Construction Coming Soon

 

RQ Design Group will be launching 

a new campaign in November. 


Stay tuned.


Thanks for watching this idea unfold.



Storm Ventilation & Fresh Water Retrieval System

Latest version of the storm ventilation and fresh water retrieval system located at the apex of the roof where as my partner, Steve Quinlan, suggested might be a better location for gathering fresh water. The fan at right would be the ventilation for normal, non-storm times, pulling air through the house in the same way as an attic fan. In all cases there are floor vents in the loft and main floor areas so that air circulates through the whole building from the lowest and coolest area--under the house.
The intake funnel would be protected from wind-borne debris by layers of screening of various weights, coarse to fine. Sturdy, long lasting PVC ball joints would regulate flow.
___________________________________________________________________________

Also . . .

My partner, Steve Quinlan, has agreed to supply not only land to build on, but has also volunteered his wild bamboo stock and agreed to pay for some materials to build one, potentially two prototype houses-- a great opportunity to further the cause of providing inexpensive alternative disaster resistant container based construction. Building done right from the start. 
Steve is a Canadian expat who lives on Jeju Island off the coast of South Korea with his Korean wife and two children. He and his wife, Sui are both English teachers and own a private English academy on the island. They have been residents of South Korea for many years, committed to continuing to live and work in South Korea and are both keenly interested in promoting concepts in alternative, sustainable living. To that end, they successfully purchased an electric vehicle with financial assistance provided by the Korean Federal Environment Ministry, The Jeju Provincial Government and Jeju Smart Grid  Department. This year The Jeju Government offered monetary incentives to over 600 lucky individuals toward the purchase of an EV. Why lucky? There was so much interest generated by the incentive, that the government had to conduct 2 lotteries, in the Spring and Summer, to allocate the funds. Next year, government incentives will be offered to only 1,500 lucky individuals. The Jeju Government has a very aggressive agenda to make the entire Island fossil fuel free. 
I have known Steve since 2009. We are friends as well as colleagues and I welcome him to this effort. 
___________________________

Fold-out Tent Design Architecture

Small structures showing various fold-out possibilities for the design concept.

    

  

___________________


Excerpts from the letter Philips North America wrote to this campaign.


"Out of all the creative, diverse entries, you’ve been selected to move forward to the next phase of the Philips Innovation Fellows competition.


" . . . your campaign has already been recognized by Philips as a meaningful innovation that we believe will help people live healthier, more sustainable lives. 

___________________

The following comment came from Professor Jake Rom Cadag, professor at the University of the Philippines, Diliman, and co-author of the article in the East Asia Forum, "A hard Act to follow: disaster risk reduction in the Philippines."


"Your concept of typhoon and earthquake resistant housing is truly interesting. I think your ideas would be very useful for the disaster managers and local government units during recovery process."

--Jake Rom Cadag, Geographer, Ph.D. 
   Department of Geography, University of the Philippines Diliman


___________________________________________________


The Story


“When you’re designing any architectural structure, the first step is to understand the location and context.”

               --Kaeper Kowalski, architect and photographer


Reason for this Campaign

Not a year ago, on November 8, 2013, Typhoon Haiyan (Yolanda in the Philippines) struck that country causing  catastrophic damage and the deaths of more than 7,000 people and displacing 10's of millions more, mostly in Tacloban, the city that took the hardest hit and where I happened to visit briefly about two and a half years earlier. With sustained winds of 195 mph (314 kph) and gusts to 220 mph (354 kph), it was estimated to be the strongest storm to ever make landfall with wind speeds even greater than that of Hurricane Camille that hit the Gulf Coast of the U.S. in 1969. 

Bahay kubo house, Philippines, c. 1895.


This concept is the realization of traditional nipa hut, bahay kubo, architecture, above, combined with modern tent design on a  shipping container or conex base to create a synthesis that dispenses with traditional western style housing concepts. It is typhoon and earthquake resistant design that we have applied to both residential housing and multi-use buildings that can be built for a fraction of the cost in the Philippines of a western-style wood frame or masonry structure. Importantly, it is adaptable and flexible in the storm tossed climate of the tropics. It is non-traditional in concept, but logical, and pushes aside the craft and materials intensive construction methods of western architectural methods and adopts a different way of thinking for buildings in the tropics that is affordable, flexible, sustainable and safe.

Living in a tropical climate differs greatly from temperate zone regions where protection against the cold for six months out of the year is the over-riding concern. Protection in the tropics is about short-term safety in the event of a severe storm--a typhoon, a hurricane, a cyclone. 

_________________________________________________________________________

Fold-Up Tent Design: Small Building

At top, the fold-up design partially folded up in preparation for a storm. At bottom, the structure folded out showing framework and awnings in place for protection from sun or rain and floor panels forming a veranda that extends all away around the building that can be used as sleeping, dining or work areas.

Fold-out stages of a house or small building

Most thinking about building design centers on sturdy passivity--a building sits, taking whatever nature throws at it. This proposal changes that thinking in an area where extreme weather events are seasonally frequent, violent but short in duration and where the climate is largely calm with a consistent warm temperature--The Tropics. It's an active approach to building design in which spaces adapt and interact to various weather. Where masonry, stone and concrete are enduring, but also expensive and permanent, this method relies on an active flexibility using much less costly materials and craftsmanship--and uses both sparingly. It represents a low-cost method of building a living and working space using a core structure of cargo containers and a construction method allowing for a majority of the spaces to be folded up against the sides of the core for protection from severe weather. Quickly and easily, it folds inward for protection and expands outward when a storm has passed.

These buildings will be designed with minimum skill set knowledge  and available resources available. Buildings would sit on stilts, minimizing foundation preparation expense and allowing for greater air circulation through floor and ceiling ventilation. The roof is steeply pitched, also for interior circulation benefit through vents in the tall ceiling as well as for exterior shedding of ash from a volcanic eruption which occur frequently in the Philippines.  

Floor panels, acting as large shutters, pull upward to cover the house completely in the event of a storm. Under those panels, the roof and wall awnings are used as a waterproofing barrier between the louvered windows and the floor panels, creating a sandwich of protective layers. 


Fold-Up Tent Design: Two Story Building

Above, shows the two-story multi-purpose building folded out.
These drawings show a a two story structure with a core of two 40-foot containers spaced eight feet apart with framed flooring and wall/window treatment between that give a total protected space of 1,820 sq. ft. (169 sq. m.) and a fold out space of 4,480 sq. ft. (416 sq. m.)

Below, the building folded up in preparation for a storm.

In an emergency this shelter provides:

1. Refuge in a storm--public emergency shelters built inexpensively whose purpose is to provide a temporary haven before and after a severe weather event.

2. Buildings where people can be cared for through a program of food and medical assistance in a place where emergency care can be provided in an accessible location.

Schools or other public buildings
Schools especially, with their open rooms can be multi-purpose buildings, providing not only a learning environment, but also act as a safe haven in storms or other catastrophic natural events. Perhaps a make-shift post office in an emergency where people need to receive funds from family overseas.

Business and residential
Shops or stores on the first floor, residential on the second level. Multi-use concepts can envision all sorts of applications in this modular, expandable building method.
_____________________________________________________________________________

Funding Objective

Funding for this project will go towards the planning and construction of a prototype, a small building similar in design to one of the drawings below. This is a necessary first step in researching, developing, implementing and testing these innovative ideas. We need your help! Once we have built, tested and have working blueprints, then we can offer the design to governments in Tropical regions and to you. 

   

Costs of Small Building Construction

The prototype requires expenses devoted to working out construction and other issues that will be minimized as more units are built until a smooth start-to-finish program can be implemented for creating multiple housing units efficiently at a low cost. With that in mind, it is difficult to know all the expenses involved at this early stage. Research into costs of building a traditional  house indicated that using mostly traditional materials, a square foot cost was about $5.50. All costs include materials and labor. The labor cost is estimated at a little above the average per hour cost in the Philippines for this kind of work.

Used shipping containers can be purchased easily from various suppliers. One supplier contacted in Manila, for example, could supply a 20-ft. container for $2,000, plus an estimated $250 or less for shipping to a site not far away in Angeles. Depending on the distance from a supply company, delivery price would vary considerably.

Foundation work, would be stilt construction that is easy to install and which doesn't require elaborate site preparation. Six poured reinforced concrete 10-inch columns would provide the primary support for the containers. Or, in certain situations, the use of pressure treated wood pilings with a polymer coating could offer, perhaps, less expensive alternative. Four-inch treated timber posts set on reinforced concrete or stone blocks would provide the secondary support for the fold-up sections of the building. Estimated cost: $2,750.

Deck framework, using 2x6 and 2x8 treated timbers in a configuration shown in the illustration is estimated at $1,200.

Floor panels using untreated 2x4s and bamboo is estimated at $2,000.

Surface finishing, including adding an insulating paint additive developed by NASA for the Space Shuttle applied to exterior container walls--estimate $.50/sq.ft. $250.

Wall/window treatments, other finishes including sliding, louvered (jalousie) window; awnings, fixtures for kitchen and bathroom; and utilities are other expenses--estimate, $4,000.


While $11 a square foot is still out of reach for much of the population in many areas in tropical regions, using this building method for public structures such as libraries, schools, clinics, offices, etc. is a practical use for this construction method. Much more thought should be given to providing a low cost building style for businesses and public spaces. Also keep in mind that this  is the smallest of structures. Building bigger in this case would be building better--and cheaper.


Once an efficient building construction method is established, it is realistic that a 1,280 sq. ft. (119 sq. m.) or larger building, can be built in a week.


Cost breakdown--1,280sq.ft. (119sq.m.)

  • Containers and delivery                                                                             $4,250
  • Foundation work                                                                                             2,750
  • Deck framework                                                                                             1,200
  • Floor panels                                                                                                     2,000
  • Surface finishes                                                                                                 250
  • Window/wall treatments; fixtures & utilities                                          4,000

___________________________________________________________________________
Total estimated cost                                                                                     $14,450

Cost/sq. ft.: $11 to $12 ($117 to $125/sq. m.)

The goal is to have enough capital to build two, preferably three, of these small buildings to work out the details of design and construction. A great portion of the work in designing and implementing these ideas will be carried out by the team, Steve and myself. Monies raised will cover building materials and contract work, consultation expenses on details of construction and design and finalizing plans. 

Lynn Ridenour: With experience in several fields--landscape designer and construction supervisor, newspaper management, in addition to other professional accomplishments, I have an broad background in arriving at practical solutions to myriad problems of design and solving logistical problems--especially my years as start-up production coordinator for American City Business Journals (ACBJ) where I assisted in the startup of nine business publications throughout the U.S. from 1980 to 1986 and was a key member of the team who developed the business model for successful business newspapers and as layout designer and photo editor of a series of award winning designs as I traveled from one city to another. Later, in 1998, I was a partner in the startup of On the Prairie, Art of the Land, a landscape company in Denver, Colo. that specialized in sustainable, xeric landscape design. In addition to that professional experience, during the years, I developed skills in a variety of building trades, including, but not limited to house construction and renovation that included carpentry, electrical, plumbing and interior/exterior construction and finishes, etc.

Also, I have some first hand appreciation of the power of storms, having spent time camping and experiencing some severe weather. Once, off the coast of California near Half Moon Bay, where a storm of more than 100 mph sustained winds and gusts to 125 mph buffeted my small tent, with me in it, perched overlooking the ocean on the bluff's edge--circumstances under which I gained some appreciation for tent architecture which I have applied to this design and construction approach to building.

____________________________________________________________________________

Addenda

Cable Tracking Device and Pole Support System

The drawing shows the assembly support for the combination roof and vertical members including a pulley for the steel cable that attaches to the roof. A little complex, but easily disassembled and assembled. This assembly process is in contrast to rope and bamboo which does not have this capability. Six of these are required for the small house illustrated above. Most of the parts are off the shelf. The 'U' shaped connectors may have to be manufactured. A tracking shield would be included so that the cable does not pop out of the groove of the pulley.

The mechanism supports four bamboo rails, two horizontal, one vertical and one lateral, plus supporting the steel cable which will give stability to the structure in breezes not strong enough to batten down the hatches for a bad storm. 

___________________________________________________________________________

Earthquake Resistant Foundation Design

Seismic engineers have to take two forces into consideration when building for earthquake resistance. It came as a big surprise to everyone when the Loma Prieta earthquake that jostled the Bay Area with a 7.0 force of energy sheared off bolts a meter in diameter that formed the support for the eastern section of the Bay Bridge. The bridge had been designed for vertical earthquake forces, but to amazement, it was learned that lateral forces were at play as well. Prior to that nerve racking event, as I was there, earlier engineers from the Univ. of Calif./Berkeley had been working on an idea for seismic cushion based the use of giant springs. I never knew what became of that research, but at the time I thought it was an ingenious concept—coil and cushion—both lateral and vertical. Like an undercarriage for a stagecoach or a car.

I propose a design that uses tightly packed rubber for lateral and vertical flexibility in combination with stability provided by heavy steel plates. Additional vertical flex would be had by setting the support column of the house into a steel collar inside which it can move up and down as the flex of rubber cushion would allow. The rubber cushion would be supplied by used tires, truck tires most probably which have a larger diameter, 100 cm. or greater in diameter. The steel plates, smaller in diameter than the tires at 65 cm., could be manhole covers.

Except for the outer tire, the tires have their sidewalls sheared off and are tightly packed into a doughnut that is larger in diameter to that of the steel plate (manhole cover) that sits as a part of a layered sandwich of metal and rubber. The shaft of the wood stilt runs through this sandwich and floats within a steel collar welded to another steel plate at the base, moving up and down with vertical motion. The extending edges of the tightly packed rubber cushion of tires act as cushion for lateral motion against the wall of the reinforced concrete cylinder. 


Floor Plans and Elevation for 40x40 ft. House

___________________________________________________________________________



Earthquake Resistant Foundation Design
Seismic engineers have to take two forces into consideration
when building for earthquake resistance. It came as a big surprise to everyone
when the Loma Prieta earthquake that jostled the Bay Area with a 7.0 force of
energy sheared off bolts a meter in diameter that formed the support for the
eastern section of the Bay Bridge. The bridge had been designed for vertical
earthquake forces, but to amazement, it was learned that lateral forces were at
play as well. Prior to that nerve racking event, as I was there, earlier
engineers from the Univ. of Calif./Berkeley had been working on an idea for
seismic cushion based the use of giant springs. I never knew what became of
that research, but at the time I thought it was an ingenious concept—coil and
cushion—both lateral and vertical. Like an undercarriage for a stagecoach or a
car.
I propose a design that uses tightly packed rubber for lateral and vertical
flexibility in combination with stability provided by heavy steel plates. Additional
vertical flex would be had by setting the support column of the house into a
steel collar inside which it can move up and down as the flex of rubber cushion
would allow. The rubber cushion would be supplied by used tires, truck tires
most probably which have a larger diameter, 100 cm. or greater in diameter. The
steel plates, smaller in diameter than the tires at 65 cm., could be manhole
covers. 

Except
for the outer tire, the tires have their sidewalls sheared off and are tightly
packed into a doughnut that is larger in diameter to that of the steel plate
(manhole cover) that sits as a part of a layered sandwich of metal and rubber.
The shaft of the wood stilt runs through this sandwich and floats within a
steel collar welded to another steel plate at the base, moving up and down with
vertical motion. The extending edges of the tightly packed rubber cushion of
tires act as cushion for lateral motion against the wall of the reinforced concrete
cylinder. 



Floor Plans and Elevation for 40x40 ft. House

story:
Tens is a filter sunglasses brand that was imagined by three friends (Kris, Marty and Tom - the three idiots in the video above) on a road trip through the Scottish Highlands. We applied our background in photography and filmmaking to develop a custom filter lens that drenches your world in rich, warm tones. Basically, sunglasses that make everyday life look and feel ten times better.

In 2014, we successfully crowdfunded our original filter lens which many described as “an Instagram filter for real life” right here on Indiegogo, and has since been enjoyed by thousands across the globe! We promised we wouldn’t make another lens filter until we found something special. Well, we might have just done that.
 


Five years on, we’re back to unveil a new visual experience called “Spectachrome” and we’re inviting you - our whole community and beyond - to help bring it to life!
 


Spectachrome is a new and limited edition lens filter inspired by the distinct colour palettes of Wes Anderson films such as “Moonrise Kingdom”, “The Royal Tenenbaums” and “Hotel Chevalier”. Working with a group of optical experts based in Lyon, France for the past 12 months; we’ve developed a lens that delivers a mesmerising colour shift, combining rich emerald greens and accentuated citron tones.  





Experience a view that transports you to a whimsical world of vintage cinema and celluloid film, a place you’ll want to revisit time and time again. At first glance, the lens may appear to look primarily orange but whilst looking through it, it offers a far wider colour spectrum than what initially meets the eye. Wearing Spectachrome feels like walking into a scene of a sun-bleached 1970’s postcard.
 


Our category 2 lens is manufactured in a world-leading lens supplier located in Northern Italy and features full UV400 protection, blocking 100% of harmful rays whilst offering a unique viewing experience.
 


Don't just take our word for it. Read thousands of reviews from people who love our original lens filter (or hey, at least the first page!).
 


Our collection is designed in Scotland and developed in France. Each frame is handcrafted to ensure a level of craftsmanship that we're really proud of. They're made from optical grade, plant-based Mazzucchelli acetate which originates from renewable resources such as wood pulp & natural cotton fibres. This means that a) you get a higher quality product and b) the impact on the environment is dramatically lower than regular plastic sunglasses.
 

 

 

 

 

 

 


Your sunglasses will come in a sustainable, travel-friendly presentation tube which is made with 100% recyclable materials plus a super soft, organic cotton pouch to protect your Tens from daily wear and tear.
 

 

 

 



 


We were driving through the Scottish Highlands in search of sunshine when we came up with the idea for Tens. Applying our background in photography & filmmaking we thought it would be cool to take the rich, warm colours we add to our photos and apply them to real life. And so, countless rounds of prototypes and one Indiegogo campaign later, Tens happened.

That was five years ago. Since then, we’ve built our community around adventure, travel and seeing things differently and we’ve been lucky to welcome thousands of people who like the same things. Spectachrome marks a whole new chapter for this little brand of ours and we can’t wait to see where it goes next!

For those that like to copy and paste, we've got you: 

Backers: indiegogo@tens.co
PR & Marketing: kris@tens.co
Wholesale Enquiries: kris@tens.co

A huge thank you for checking our campaign. If you like what you see, we'd be so grateful if you could share it your friends! 

P.S - We're @tens on just about everything! 

Instagram / Twitter / Facebook

story:
An elegant and luxurious 100% natural leather apron

“This unique leather apron is perfect for crafts people to trade professionals to the everyday cook who loves to BBQ on a warm and sunny day... and just about everyone else in between who needs an extremely comfortable, water resistant and lightweight leather apron!"

Stunningly soft + Built tough
It's rare when an apron can be graciously supple and tough at the same time. Our apron has also been crafted to take a lifetime of abuse while remaining fully resilient and highly functional. This leather will stand the test of time.

Amazingly Comfortable
This apron weighs only half a pound and is but 0.5 to 0.6mm thick, taking comfort to a new level of amazing. It works with your body movements in a pleasant state of fluidity, minus any stiffness or hindrances. That's how premium calf leather works.

Minimalist  Design
Thanks to the minimalist design and premium soft and durable leather of our exclusive apron, you’ll enjoy an apron that contours naturally to your body, no matter what size or shape you are.

After many months of advanced product development, design modifications and prototype testing, the Smooth Leather Apron has finally entered the final production stage. By becoming an early backer, you'll be helping us finish this amazing leather apron so we can move it from the production stage to the mass-market stage (and make it available at a great introductory price to boot)!

About

Today, most of our craftswomen production is crafted for recognized brands of the leather industry, before being sold at a final retail price much greater than its manufacturing and shipping costs. With your help to get our Smooth Leather Apron to the final stage of production, not only will you get a premium, 100% natural leather product without the luxury markup...you’ll also make difference.

Thanks to your purchase, you’ll also be making a positive impact in the lives of many skilled craftswomen who do the work they love from their own home workshops, and also help to allow them to spend even more quality time with their children. It’s a WIN-WIN for everyone!

 

A Smooth Leather Apron that will stand the test of time!

A unique history & personality

Built to last
Unlike typical clothing and denim aprons that might tear down or burn with use, our minimalist and elegant aprons are crafted to always remain fully functional and supple. The apron's natural vintage finish takes on any and all “wear and tear” with grace and ease.

Easily customize & Personalize your very own Smooth Leather Apron!

Want to add a bit of customization to your new leather apron? Or maybe you want to customize it for yourself, or give it as a gift? No problem. You can have a short name or initials (up to six letters either way) directly sewn into your Smooth Leather Apron... If you need a few aprons with your company logo instead, that's fine too!

 

The Hallmark of Real Quality Leather

With the passage of time and regular use, The Smooth Leather Apron will achieve a weathered look called “Patina”. This patina is the hallmark of 100% high-quality natural leather. This gives it the rich, natural character traits and a unique history all on it’s own.  With it, we create elegant and amazingly comfortable products, and make them available for down-to-earth prices that are realistic and affordable.

 

 

When Softness & Toughness BECOME ONE

The Smooth Leather Apron is one of the world’s toughest and most resilient lightweight leather apron ever crafted by human hands. It’ll protect you from harm, while at the same time gracefully withstanding assault from small debris, oil even fire... without losing its luxurious soft and supple texture, style and unbelievable comfort!

 

It never weighs you down or gets in your way!

Ultra light
This apron weighs about 238 grams, which is about 3-5 times lighter than most leather aprons: you can wear it for hours on end, without ever feeling weighed down or worn out. In fact, you’ll barely even know you’re wearing it.

Super thin
This apron is also thinner than most clothing and denim aprons on the market. It naturally adjusts and contours with your body movements every time. This means no more chaffing folds and no more clunkiness while you work.

Gracefully supple
With the Smooth Leather Apron, no matter if you kneel down, bend over, or even dance and jump, all you’ll feel is a thin and protective layer of leather flowing with your body to protect you.

 

 

Apron Specifications

1. The Vintage Zammak Buckle

 

 

Zamak alloys aluminum, magnesium and copper with a base of 99.99% pure zinc. This makes for a much stronger stainless metal. This metal has been carefully and thoroughly brushed for a smooth and beautiful vintage finish.
 

 

 

2. An easily Adjustable Neck Strap

 

 

The adjustable neck strap lets you tighten up your apron as close to your collarbone as you wish. Feel free to tighten it up tight and snug, or let it hang loose on your chest. You can adjust it just the way you like it, every time, in a matter of seconds!

 

 

3. Ultra strong, Hardy Nylon Threads

 

 

Our unique Smooth Leather Apron has been crafted from small leather pieces which minimizes wastefulness from the overall manufacturing process. These pieces are then bound together using ultra-strong, hardy nylon threads.  

  


4. Seamless form + effortless functionality

 

The borders of each piece are folded and sewn from the inside, which is the most delicate part of the apron. Their unique shape is carefully designed to protect you from harm without restricting or constricting your own natural movements.

 

 

 

The Universal Apron: One size really does fit all!

It doesn’t matter if you’re a size 2Xs or a 4XL... or any size in between, our unique leather apron will fit your body perfectly every single time. You can be 5’1 or 6’5, a teen, a grown adult, a male or female...it doesn't matter. Our Smooth Leather Apron has been carefully crafted and designed to naturally fit any human body.

  • The Smooth Leather Apron has you covered (literally), with an “effective protection area” of about 90cm long x 57cm wide.
     
  • It also comes with a 12cm x 10cm chest pocket that’s sewn in half in order to fasten to everyday items you may want to have close to you at all times.
     
  • Keep your handkerchief within arm’s reach at all times thanks to the handy holding strap. You don’t even have to lo­­ok before you grab it, saving you time and energy.
     

  • Whether you kneel down, bend over, or even dance and jump, all you’ll feel is a thin and protective layer of leather flowing with your body to protect you. It always stays close to your body to keep you protected, but also allows you to have the freedom you desire.
     

​This is what a BBQ Pro has to say about our apron

When you order your own Smooth Leather Apron, you’ll get...

  • An amazingly soft and tough apron that’ll remain fully functional and supple, no matter how many years of wear and tear you’ll put it through.
  • An all-natural leather apron that’s made from 100% premium and delicate lather, crafted with a natural vintage finish and feel that you’ll love!
  • A naturally adjustable leather apron that adapts and contours to your own body size and shape with ease, minus any resistance or unwanted constraints. 
  • A leather apron that feels so stunningly light, thin and comfortable, that you’ll hardly even know you’re wearing it! This way you can focus on what you do best! 
  • A sleek and smooth leather apron that comes complete with a double-chest pocket and handkerchief holder. You don’t even have to look before you grab it, saving you time and energy. 
  • And last but not least, you’ll get an amazing leather apron that’s great for every day use for cooking, crafting, serving, BBQ... and just about everything else in between! 
     

 

This is what you get

Early Bird Special - $114USD

It's the apron you always wanted and it's finally here! Be among the first earthlings to claim the one and only Smooth Leather Apron in this one-time-only product prelaunch. Both customization and shipping are 100% free of charge!

 

Duo Special Discount - $238 USD

Don't you wish you could give a great gift to that special person? Of course you want to! Or maybe you just need two different types of customizations. One single Smooth Leather Apron is rarely enough anyway.

The more the Merrier - 4 - $448 USD

If you have several family members and colleagues who also like to cook or BBQ under a sunny day, this is the perfect gift for them all. Each apron can have its own unique customization. Spread the love around!

 

Party of 6 - $689 USD

This is a great choice if you have a small catering business, restaurant, club or bar n'grill. You can have all units customized with your company logo for free. They are really comfortable and can handle whatever you throw at them.

About

An Apron that’s deeply rooted in history and tradition

Each Smooth Leather Apron is created with passion and precision, that’s deeply rooted in rich leathermaking history and tradition. Every cut, every seam and every smooth edge is done the right way, to ensure that you’re only getting the best apron possible.

 

Meet the passionate people behind Zagazzi
Every garment made here at Zagazzi is handmade by many highly talented and skilled craftswomen. These are hard-working mothers and daughters who have refined the craft of leatherworking from one generation to another, while keeping family values and traditions alive and well.

We came together and joined forces for the first time 25 years ago south of Bogota, Colombia, and now we’ve grown into a single, hard-working community every since. We believe that there’s no replacement for high quality leather products created from true craftsmanship. We build authentic products that will last an entire lifetime, and we love doing it! 

 We simply love what we do.

 
 

A clean and thoughtful manufacturing process
When you consider the amount of raw materials, water and minerals or oils that are used during leather cutting and tanning, it can be a very wasteful process that adds up pretty quickly. That’s why we wanted to do things differently. We wanted to be more thoughtful and respectable to our planet, adopting several mindful processes into our manufacturing process.

Every ounce of water we use during our tanning process is thoroughly cleaned and recycled. This way it can become fully safe, drinkable water, and is never wasted. Ever. We also recycle our own chemicals so they can be used as fertilizer to help grow plentiful crops.

Furthermore, all of our aprons are created from small pieces of leather that are carefully sewn together in a specific shape and order, which allows us little to no leather waste whatsoever during our entire manufacturing process.

About our production
Everything we produce is minerally tanned. Mineral tanning ions being much smaller compared to vegetable tanning molecules, they can also mix much better with the leather at a smaller fiber level that vegetable tanning simply can’t reach.

This allows for thinner and softer leather that’s much more durable, resistant to humidity, fluids and even “wear and tear” over time. We also test leather thickness and resistance in a very thorough manner during our exclusive manufacturing process as well.

 

Disclaimers

REFUND AND WARRANTY: To check our refund and warranty policies, please visit http://www.zagazzi.com/about/#warranty 

DEFECTS: If you receive an item from us that has some sort of manufacturing defect, simply take a picture of the defect and email it to us. Once we confirm the issue, a new item will be shipped out to you for free.

NEED HELP? For any further enquiry, please contact apron@zagazzi.com
